metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11338 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
libavcodec/hevcdec.c in FFmpeg 3.4 and 4.1.2 mishandles detection of duplicate first slices, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and out-of-array access) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted HEVC data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11338` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.1.3-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.1.3-1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.1.3-1
libavcodec58 - 7:4.1.3-1
libavdevice58 - 7:4.1.3-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.1.3-1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.1.3-1
libavfilter7 - 7:4.1.3-1
libavformat58 - 7:4.1.3-1
libavresample4 - 7:4.1.3-1
libavutil56 - 7:4.1.3-1
libpostproc55 - 7:4.1.3-1
libswresample3 - 7:4.1.3-1
libswscale5 - 7:4.1.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.1.3-1').
